title: Album Page, "Elevation and Plan of Façade of San Bernadino, Perugia, Italy", late 19th century
medium: Graphite, trace of brush and gray wash on off-white wove paper with deckled edge tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Watermark: Double inscribed circle containing an anchor, each terminal ending in an arrow.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite: bottom right center: San Bernadino / Perugia.  Various inscriptions with measurements of architectural elements throughout.
dimensions: Sheet: 31.6 x 21.2 cm (12 7/16 x 8 3/8 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet with elevation of two-story building façade consisting of a large central arch above a double doorway in the center below.  Niches supported by a sill sitting upon dentils or modillions are framed by columns supporting triangular pediments at left.  The building is completed with a low, pitched roof. Below this drawing is a plan view of the doorway indicating that the entrance itself is recessed from the surface of the façade and flanked by a canted enframement on either side.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Elevation and Plan of Façade of San Bernadino, Perugia, Italy", late 19th century.Graphite, trace of brush and gray wash on off-white wove paper with deckled edge tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-284.
